intro: Pouzolzia weddellii var. humbertii, commonly known as the Weddell's pouzolzia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and dense, compact foliage. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth, waxy surface.
